body:

Depends on play-style and the champs played as support. Some people play aggressive APC champs as support (they can compensate for the lack of ap damage - if both mid and top chose ad - but it can also work as a 2nd apc). As an aggressive AP support ({{champion:63}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:161}}  and so on... ) - your efficiency comes from harassing the enemy with abilities. As long as you're doing a good job at pressuring the enemy - without doing CS both lane (cause then you're trolling your adc) - you can still be a good support. While latter on you can also play as a 2nd APC. 

Some players - get auto-filled and they don't pick any support items (thus - they gain no gold from their role as a support), instead they go ap items from start and troll the adc - by taking his farm. Those are the only players that i wouldn't call support (more like trolls). And also a big NO NO! Unless it's some premade who plays 2 apc bot lane (something that worked for them). The usual meta is not mandatory and far from being as efficient as it used to be (back when LoL revolved around ADC's as the main source of dealing tons of damage).
But again luden's does less damage, a brand would lose damage if he built it over liandry's since the passive is much better and the support item gives enough mana.
